metadata.description: ECI-standardised voting day rules, allowed ID documents, poll timings, EVM/VVPAT guidance, prohibited items, and PwD/elderly facilities.
metadata.note: Rules are standardised across all Indian state elections. Kerala-specific details noted where applicable.

general.note: Timings are standard for Kerala Assembly elections. Final timings will be confirmed in official notification.

poll_timings.last_voter_rule: Any voter who is present in the queue at 6:00 PM is entitled to cast their vote even if it extends beyond closing time.

mock_poll.purpose: EVM/VVPAT functionality is publicly tested before the actual poll begins. Agents and observers can witness this.

allowed_photo_id_documents.description: Voters must carry any ONE of the following valid photo ID documents to the polling station.

primary_id.name: Elector Photo Identity Card (EPIC / Voter ID)
primary_id.note: This is the preferred document. Carry it if you have one.

alternative_ids.document: MNREGA Job Card issued by State Government
Passbooks with photograph issued by Bank / Post Office
Health Insurance Smart Card issued under Ministry of Labour scheme
Smart Card issued by RGI under NPR
Service Identity Card with photograph issued by Central / State Govt / PSUs / Public Ltd Companies
Unique Disability ID (UDID) Card issued by Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Overseas Voter (NRI): Original Passport only (no alternative accepted)

allowed_photo_id_documents.important_note: The name in the document must match the name in the electoral roll. Expired driving licences and expired passports are generally NOT accepted.

polling_slip.description: A Voter Slip (polling slip) is distributed by the BLO or political parties before election day.
polling_slip.purpose: It tells the voter their booth number, serial number in roll, and polling station address.
polling_slip.note: Polling slip alone is NOT sufficient to vote. A valid photo ID from the approved list must also be carried.

step_by_step_voting_process.action: Arrive at your assigned polling station
step_by_step_voting_process.detail: Find your booth using your polling slip, Voter ID, or the Voter Helpline 1950 / CEO Kerala website.
Separate queues may be available for general voters, senior citizens, and PwD voters. PwD voters get priority access.

step_by_step_voting_process.action: Show photo ID to polling officer at Table 1
step_by_step_voting_process.detail: Polling officer verifies your name in the marked copy of the electoral roll.
Ink is applied on the left index finger (or as designated). This prevents double voting.

step_by_step_voting_process.action: Sign or thumb impression in register
step_by_step_voting_process.detail: You sign the voter register (Form 17A) to confirm your identity.

step_by_step_voting_process.action: Receive ballot number slip from Table 2
step_by_step_voting_process.detail: Polling officer issues a ballot number slip to allow you to proceed to the EVM.
Enter the voting compartment. Press the button on the Ballot Unit next to your chosen candidate's name/symbol. A beep confirms your vote.
A paper slip will appear in the transparent VVPAT window showing the candidate's name and symbol. It is visible for approximately 7 seconds before being cut and stored in the sealed VVPAT box.
Your vote has been cast. Do not linger inside the polling station.

evm.how_it_works: The Ballot Unit shows candidate names and symbols. Pressing the button next to a candidate casts one vote. Each EVM can record a maximum of 2000 votes and support up to 64 candidates.
evm.tamper_proof: EVMs are standalone devices with no network connectivity. They cannot be hacked remotely.

vvpat.purpose: Provides a physical paper verification that the vote was recorded for the intended candidate.
vvpat.visibility: The printed slip is visible through a transparent window for approximately 7 seconds.
vvpat.storage: Slip is automatically cut and stored in a sealed box — cannot be removed by voter.
vvpat.auditability: VVPAT slips can be counted/audited by ECI order to verify EVM results.

prohibited_items_at_polling_station: Mobile phones (inside voting compartment — may be allowed in premises, rules vary by state)
Party flags, banners, or campaign materials
prohibited_activities_on_poll_day: Campaigning or canvassing within 100 metres of a polling station
Displaying election symbols or party flags near the booth
Taking photographs or videos inside the voting compartment
Interfering with a voter's right to vote in secret
Carrying weapons near a polling station (Section 144 CrPC applies)

silence_period.description: No campaign activity of any kind is allowed during the silence period.
silence_period.duration: 48 hours before the scheduled closing of polls
silence_period.applies_to: All political parties, candidates, and their representatives

pwd_and_elderly_facilities.title: Facilities for Persons with Disabilities (PwD) and Senior Citizens

facilities.detail: All polling stations must have ramp access for wheelchair users.
PwD voters and senior citizens (80+) are entitled to vote without waiting in the general queue.
A voter with a disability may be accompanied by a companion of their choice (18+ years) to assist in the voting compartment.
Booth Level Officers may be assigned to assist PwD/elderly voters reach the polling station in some constituencies.
Braille stickers on ballot units are available for visually impaired voters at accessible booths.

facilities.facility: Home Voting (Postal Ballot for 85+ and PwD)
facilities.detail: Voters aged 85 and above and voters with 40%+ disability are eligible to cast vote via postal ballot from home. Apply to ERO before deadline.
ECI mandates that all polling stations be on the ground floor or have ramp access. Signage, furniture, and layout must be accessible.

tender_vote.description: If someone else has already voted in your name (impersonation), you are entitled to cast a Tender Vote.
tender_vote.process: Inform the Presiding Officer immediately. A Tender Ballot Paper (pink) will be issued. Your tender vote is kept separately and counted only if there is evidence of impersonation.
tender_vote.note: Your vote is protected. You will not be turned away.

indelible_ink_rules.applied_on: Left index finger (or as designated by Presiding Officer)
indelible_ink_rules.purpose: Prevents a person from voting more than once
indelible_ink_rules.permanence: The ink is permanent and cannot be washed off easily — it fades over several weeks

cannot_do: Recommend which candidate or party to vote for
Provide opinions on political parties or candidates
Access or confirm whether a specific person voted
